112470000000568,"1228509093","TEN-T Project Management Workshop - 3 December 2008","

The TEN-T Project Management Workshop, organised by the Agency on 3 December 2008 in Brussels, attracted over 300 participants.
The Workshop provided key information about the Agency&rsquo
column2: s activities and services to its core audience of TEN-T beneficiaries and stakeholders. It also served as a valuable forum for discussion about important issues pertinent to the successful implementation of the TEN-T programme.

112470000001974,"1237205637","Thank you for registering for the 2013 Financial Engineering Workshop","

Thank you for registering for the 2013 Financial Engineering Workshop. We are processing your registration and will get back to you shortly with a confirmation e-mail once we validate the information. If you do not receive a confirmation, this means that your registration was not accepted.
Please do not book ahead your travel if you have not yet received the confirmation e-mail from the TEN-T EA.

If you have any additional questions regarding your registration or the workshop itself, please contact us.

",\N,\N

112470000004144,"1238168824","Privacy policy","

The personal data that you provide is processed in accordance with Regulation (EC) N° 45/2001 on the "protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data by the Community institutions " of the European Parliament and the Council of 18 December 2000.

In this respect, the Agency's Data Protection Officer ensures that the provisions of the Regulation are applied and advises data controllers on fulfilling their obligations (see art. 24 of the Regulation).

The European Data Protection Supervisor will act as an independent supervisory authority (see art. 41 to 45 of the Regulation). The controller of the present processing operation is Agency Executive Director Dirk Beckers.

The lawfulness of this processing operation is based on the fact that the processing of data is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the general interest of the European Communities on the basis of the Treaties or other legal instruments adopted on the basis thereof.
The purpose of this processing operation is first to process your event registration. It maybe used by the Agency in order to collect a subscription list for a future INEA eNewsletter.

The recipients of your data will be the Agency's Information and Communications Department. The information in question will not be communicated to third parties, except where necessary for the purposes outlined above or when the data subject has explicitly given its unambiguous consent.
Your data will be kept for two years. In case you would like to delete it from our records, please contact us.

You have the right to access your personal data at any time and the right to correct any inaccurate or incomplete information. You also have the right to be erased from the list upon written request. Should you have any queries concerning the processing of your personal data or a request to access your personal data, please contact us.

You may also address any question to the Data Protection Officer of the Innovation and Networks Executive Agency INEA-DPO@ec.europa.eu and you have the right of recourse at any time to the European Data Protection Supervisor.

",\N,\N

112470000036830,"1253259092","TEN-T Project Management Workshop, 12-13 January 2010","

The TEN-T EA
column2: organised  its  second  Project  Management  Workshop  in  Brussels  on<strong>  12-13&nbsp
column3: January 2010 at the Centre Conference Albert Borschette (Rue Froissart 36, B-1040 Brussels). The event, which mirrored the first Project Management Workshop held in December 2008,

112470000866455,"1271362493","TEN-T Info Day & Seminar on TEN-T Project Finance & PPP's: 31 May - 1 June 2010","

The TEN-T Executive Agency
column2: held  a  two-day  event  on  31  May  -  1  June,  featuring  the  2010  TEN-T  Calls  Info  Day  and  Seminar  on  TEN-T  Project  Finance  &amp
column3: PPPs. These complementary events gone potential TEN-T project applicants key information about the calls and selection process, as well as a more in-depth look into public-private partnerships. See the links below for the presentations and video footage from both days.

column1: The Info Day, held in the Borschette Center in Brussels (Belgium),
column2: provided  information  to  current  and  prospective  beneficiaries  on  the  2010  Annual  and  Multi-Annual  Calls.&nbsp

column1: This new event aimed at providing a forum for discussion on TEN-T project finance in general and PPPs in particular. It was scheduled to follow the Info Day to give participants the possibility to attend both and took place in the same venue (Borschette Center, Brussels).

112470001006395,"1273583922","TEN-T EA Good Practice Working Group on Financial and Project Management","

The TEN-T Executive Agency is organising a series of meetings between its staff and beneficiaries to simplify and improve procedures and combine synergies to find more effective ways for you to manage projects, especially:
• debate financial and project management practices, including those used by the Agency
• identify hints and tips from your experience
• present these findings in info fiches at our next annual TEN-T Project Management Workshop.

Consequently, the Good Practice Working Group on Financial and Project Management has been created and it is already scheduled to meet twice during the remainder of 2010 to address the topics proposed by beneficiaries. Membership of the group is voluntary and still open. If you wish to know more about how to join and participate to its meetings (and propose one of the pre-identified topics for discussion), please send an email to
column2: ">TENEA-financial-report@ec.europa.eu enclosing the call for interest form .xls (88 KB).

column1: This meeting will be devoted to further identifying topics, initiating the debates, and organising smaller working groups to advance the outcomes of the discussions to produce the draft info fiches.
Meeting details will be available at a later date.

The meetings will start around 9.30/10.00 and finish at 16.30 (more details will be available shortly), will be held in English without interpretation in any other European language and will take place in the TEN-T Executive Agency premises in Brussels, Belgium. Please note that you will be responsible for your own travel and logistics costs concerning your participation.

If you have any additional questions about the Working Group, feel free to contact us!

---

112470002027837,"1288866303","TEN-T Project Management Workshop - 15-16 February 2011","

The TEN-T Executive Agency organised its third annual Project Management Workshop on 15 and 16 February 2011 at the Charlemagne building in Brussels, Belgium. The event was aimed at gathering beneficiaries together to discuss key topics relevant for successsul cooperation and provide more information on:
As in the previous years, the event featured simultaneous translation in English-French-German-Italian-Spanish. The video recordings in all of these languages are available below.

Due to the large size of the video files it is advised to save them on your computer before attempting to play them. In order to do so, right-click on the file you wish to save and choose the "Save as " or Save link as " options.

We are currently processing your registration and will get back to you shortly with a confirmation e-mail once we validate the information you have submitted. This is to ensure a fair balance of participants as the capacity of the conference venue is limited.
If you do not receive this confirmation, your registration was not accepted.
Please do not book ahead your travel if you have not yet received the confirmation e-mail from the TEN-T EA.

112470003244028,"1347364431","2012 TEN-T November events","

---

Three key TEN-T events took place on 27-28-29 November 2012 in Brussels, organised by the European Commission, and for the Info Day jointly with the TEN-T Executive Agency. A Business Summit was followed by the annual TEN-T Day conference and the Agency's Info Day for the 2012 Calls for Proposals took place on the third day.

High level business leaders and selected European decision-makers debated the importance transport plays for growth and jobs, the role of European transport policy and the challenges for promoting Europe's global competitiveness.
28 November: TEN-T Day 2012

Commission Vice-President Siim Kallas, ministers, members of the European Parliament and key stakeholders gathered together to discuss the future development of the trans-European transport network, with a special focus on innovation and implementation tools like corridors.

column2: ">29 November: TEN-T Info Day on the 2012 Calls for Proposals

column1:
The TEN-T Executive Agency, together with the European Commission, presented the priorities and funding possibilities of the 2012 TEN-T Calls for Proposals and provided practical information on how to submit a successful project proposal in order to receive financial support.

112470003320909,"1348047368","2012 TEN-T Calls for Proposals Info Day","

The TEN-T Executive Agency organised, together with the European Commission, the 2012 TEN-T Calls for Proposals Info Day in Brussels on 29 November 2012, to provide practical information about the funding opportunities available in this year's Call, and on how to submit a successful project proposal in order to receive financial support.
The Info Day followed the 28 November TEN-T Day organised by DG MOVE. More information is available on the event's website.

The 2013 TEN-T Project Management Workshop, the annual event organised by the Agency to discuss with its beneficiaries issues relating to the financial and operational implementation of the TEN-T projects, was held in Brussels on 21 February 2013. The venue was the European's Commission Centre Conference Albert Borschette (CCAB), located at Rue Froissart 36, 1040 Brussels.

Commissioner Violeta Bulc, ministers, members of the European Parliament and key stakeholders will gather together in Riga, Latvia on 22-23 June 2015 to discuss the future development of the trans-European transport network, with a special focus on the Core Network Corridors, their implementation and financing.
The event will be organised by DG MOVE. INEA will also be fully participating in the event.
To know more about the event and to register as a participant, please visit the TEN-T Days website!
From Investment Programme to Project Implementation

This one-day event, organised by the TEN-T Executive Agency, aimed to discuss key issues related to the screening and preparation of projects to be delivered as Public-Private Partnerships (PPPs) and equivalent models, including preparing a 'bond friendly' PPP.
The keynote speaker was Mr David Livingston, former Chief Executive Officer of Infrastructure Ontario and former Chief of Staff of the Premier of the Province of Ontario, Canada.

The workshop was conducted in an interactive manner in order to maximise the opportunity to exchange best practice and identify the key issues relevant for PPP projects within the TEN-T investment programme.
The conference was held in the Charlemagne building of the European Commission.
Webstreaming - watch a video replay of the event

*Infrastructure Ontario (IO) is a crown agency of the Ontario government focused on modernising and financing the renewal of public infrastructure, maximising the value of public real estate and managing government facilities. IO provides project delivery, lending, real estate management and asset planning expertise primarily to the Province and municipalities across Ontario.

Integrated Transport Info Day 2013","

The first round of calls under the Smart, Green and Integrated Transport challenge of the new Horizon 2020 Framework Programme will be published at the end of the year.

column1: To support the preparation of proposals, the Transport Directorate of the European Commission's Research and Innovation Directorate General is organising an Information Day on 18 December 2013, from 9 AM till 6 PM in the Charlemagne building, rue de la Loi 170, Brussels.

The aim of the day is to inform potential participants in the first round of calls under the Smart, Green and Integrated Transport Challenge of the new Horizon 2020 Framework Programme and to offer some unique opportunities for networking.

112470010979933,"1394457911","Inauguration of the Innovation and Networks Executive Agency","

The Innovation and Networks Executive Agency (INEA) was officially inaugurated on 6 March 2014 with an event to recognise its new mandate and the ongoing successes in project implementation.

European Commission Vice-Presidents Siim Kallas (Transport) and Neelie Kroes (Digital Agenda) as well as Robert-Jan Smits (Director-General of DG RTD), Matthias Ruete (Director-General of DG MOVE and Chairman of INEA’s Steering Committee), Fabrizio Barbaso (Deputy Director-General of DG ENER), and Dirk Beckers (INEA Executive Director) delivered short welcome addresses to commemorate the new Agency, which is responsible for implementing parts of the Connecting Europe Facility and Horizon 2020 programmes on behalf of the Commission.

column2:
">Read the full news item about the inauguration

112470111237838,"1396865532","2014 CEF Energy Info Day","

The Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) Energy Info Day for the 2014 Call for Proposals took place on Friday, 23 May 2014 in the Charlemagne building (170 rue de la Loi), room Gasperi, in Brussels, Belgium. The event presented the priorities for the
column2: ">2014 CEF Energy call for proposals – the first call under the new Connecting Europe Facility.

column1: The Connecting Europe Facility was set up for the period 2014-2020 to provide the EU financial assistance to projects of common interest in transport, energy and telecommunications infrastructure sectors, in order to accelerate investment in the trans-European networks and to exploit potential synergies between these sectors.
In the energy sector, CEF will, in particular, support projects in electricity and gas in order to achieve the following objectives:
• increasing competitiveness by promoting the further integration of the internal energy market and the interoperability of electricity and gas networks across borders
• contributing to sustainable development and protection of the environment - including by the integration of energy from renewable sources and by the development of smart energy networks

In addition to the information on the priorities of the 2014 call(s) for proposals and the policy context, the Info Day also provided participants with practical information about how to prepare a successful proposal, as well as other background information relevant to the application and evaluation process.
A recording of the event is available using the following link:

Ms Iris Valkovic, Policy Officer, Unit D.1, DG Environment

112470114570723,"1422609389","2015 CEF Energy Info Day","

The Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) Energy Info Day for the
column2: ">first of the 2015 Calls for Proposals took place on Monday, 16 March 2015 in Brussels.

column1: The event, organised by DG Energy and INEA, presented the priorities of the Call that was launched on 4 March.

The Connecting Europe Facility was set up for the period 2014-2020 to provide the EU financial assistance to projects of common interest in transport, energy and telecommunications infrastructure sectors, in order to accelerate investment in the trans-European networks and to exploit potential synergies between these sectors.
In the energy sector, CEF will, in particular, support projects in electricity and gas in order to achieve the following objectives:
• increasing competitiveness by promoting the further integration of the internal energy market and the interoperability of electricity and gas networks across borders
• contributing to sustainable development and protection of the environment - through the integration of energy from renewable sources and the development of smart energy networks
• info on the priorities of the 2015 Call for proposals
• practical details about how to prepare a successful proposal
• other background information relevant to the application and evaluation process

Commission Vice-President Siim Kallas, ministers, members of the European Parliament and key stakeholders will gather together in Tallinn, Estonia on 16-18 October 2013 to discuss the future development of the trans-European transport network, with a special focus on financing, innovation and implementation tools like corridors.
The TEN-T Executive Agency will also be fully participating in the event.

More information is available on the event's website, where you will also be able to register!
